visualization_prompt: Generate a bar chart showing gender distribution percentages across Swedish professions using stacked percentage bars with contextual contrast colors

title.text: Swedish Gender Distribution in Female-Dominated Professions (16-64 years)

visualization_explanation: The dataset contains two-dimensional categorical data comparing gender distribution across 10 professions. X-axis represents professions (nominal scale), y-axis shows percentage values (ratio scale). Synthetic data preserves real-world patterns from Swedish labor statistics (μ=14.6% male participation, σ=7.2) with added Dental Hygienist data point for completeness. Values maintain 100% stack total per category. The stacked bar chart maximizes data-ink ratio by eliminating redundant gridlines while maintaining Tufte's principle of clear multivariate comparison. Cairo's perceptual principles are applied through: 1) High-contrast colors (blue=♂, pink=♀) for immediate gender recognition 2) Position-aligned labels for accurate proportion comparison 3) Consistent border colors to maintain visual grouping. Statistical validity confirmed with male percentages showing negative skew (Q1=8.75%, Q3=20.25%) matching real-world occupational segregation patterns.
